snippet: The reluctance to give up fax machines offers a revealing glimpse into an aging nation that can often seem quietly determined to stick to its tried-and-true ways.
abstract: Japan remains attached to the pre-Internet technology of the fax machine, despite the country's renown for high technology and new gadgets; reluctance to give up fax machines offers a revealing glimpse into an aging nation that can often seem quietly determined to stick to its tried-and-true ways.
lead_paragraph: The reluctance to give up fax machines offers a revealing glimpse into an aging nation that can often seem quietly determined to stick to its tried-and-true ways.

headline.seo: In Japan, the Fax Machine Is Anything but a Relic
headline.main: In High-Tech Japan, the Fax Machines Roll On
headline.print_headline: In High-Tech Japan, the Fax Machines Roll On
